title: Heads and tales, or, Anecdotes and stories of quadrupeds and other beasts chiefly connected with incidents in the histories of more or less distinguished men /
snippet: A muzzled bear on its hind legs in Nicolsou Street, or at the Sciennes, was an exotic sight seldom witnessed,  and not easily forgotten. The last we saw was in Bernard Street, Leith, in 1869. That very day, the police were hunting for Bruin and its leaders all over Edinburgh.
